content.question:
<math alttext="N i with a positive 2 charge aqueous plus C d solid react to produce N i solid plus C d with a positive 2 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Cd(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ni(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals positive 0.15 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
Under standard conditions, a <math alttext="N i, C d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext><mtext>-</mtext><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> galvanic cell generates a potential of <math alttext="positive 0.15 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> using the chemical reaction represented above. Which of the following best explains how <math alttext="the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge is greater than 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> affects the cell potential if this is the only change made to the operation of the galvanic cell?

choices.label: The ratio <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of C d with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller if <math alttext="the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge is greater than 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="Q is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E sub cell is greater than E naught sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The ratio <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of C d with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller if <math alttext="the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge is greater than 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="Q is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E sub cell is greater than E naught sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The ratio <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of C d with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger if <math alttext="the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge is greater than 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="Q is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E sub cell is less than E naught sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The ratio <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of C d with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cd</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger if <math alttext="the molar concentration of N i with a positive 2 charge is greater than 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="Q is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E sub cell is less than E naught sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
